search.noResults: No programs found matching your search.

fallback.cantFind: Can't find what you need? Try these resources:

home.heroTitle: Find programs, services, and resources in the San Francisco Bay Area
home.heroSubtitle: Discover free and low-cost resources for food, housing, healthcare, utilities, and more.
home.viewAllDirectory: View all programs in directory â†’
home.selectCategory: Select a category to find programs and services

about.title: About Bay Navigator
about.subtitle: A community resource connecting Bay Area residents with free and low-cost programs
about.summary: This website lists free and discounted programs in the Bay Area. It's made by Bay Tides, a nonprofit that protects the San Francisco Bay. We don't charge anything, we don't sell your information, and we don't get paid for any listings.
about.whyWeBuiltThisDesc: Cost often determines choices. When sustainable options are more expensive, people pick what they can afford. The programs listed here help close that gap.
about.whoThisIsForDesc: Anyone in the Bay Area who wants to save money. Low-income households, seniors, veterans, students, people with disabilities, familiesâ€”there are programs for everyone.
about.environmentalCaseDesc: Many of these programs have environmental benefits:
about.envBenefitParks: Free park access connects people to nature
about.principlePrivacyDesc: No tracking, no cookies, no personal data collection. Works offline.
about.principleNoPaidListingsDesc: We never take money for placement or inclusion.
about.principleAccessibleDesc: WCAG 2.2 Level AAA compliant. Learn more
about.principleDisasterReadyDesc: After your first visit, all data is cached offline for emergencies.
about.principleOpenSourceDesc: View on GitHub
about.howWereDifferentDesc: Compare to other directories like 211 Bay Area
about.diffZeroBurdenDesc: We pull from existing government open data APIs. Organizations don't need to apply or submit forms.
about.diffFederalBenefitsDesc: We integrate USA.gov's Benefit Finder data for nationwide programs.
about.diffAiSearchDesc: Natural language queries like "I'm a 68-year-old senior who needs help with bills" work seamlessly.
about.diffOfflineFirstDesc: Works without internet once installedâ€”critical during emergencies when networks are down.
about.dataProblem: The Problem with Social Services Data
about.aboutBayTidesDesc: Bay Tides is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit founded in 2023 in Redwood City, California. We work to protect the Bay Area's shoreline through education, advocacy, and hands-on conservation.
about.getInvolvedDesc: Want to help? Report errors, suggest programs, or support our work.

directory.title: Program Directory
directory.programsAvailable: programs and services available in the Bay Area.
directory.tryAdjusting: Try adjusting your filters or search terms.
directory.verifyNotice: Programs changeâ€”always verify details with the official source before applying.

program.verifiedStale: Last verified {months} months ago - may need updating

favorites.title: My Favorites
favorites.noFavoritesDesc: Save programs you're interested in by clicking the heart icon on any program card.
favorites.privacyNotice: Your favorites are stored only on this device in your browser's local storage. We never send this data to any server.
favorites.confirmClearAll: Are you sure you want to remove all favorites? This cannot be undone.

download.title: Download Bay Navigator
download.directDownload: Direct download for Android devices. No Google Play required.
download.installStep1: Download the APK file to your Android device
download.installStep2: Open the file (you may need to allow installation from unknown sources)
download.installStep3: Follow the on-screen prompts to install
download.noTracking: No tracking - The FOSS version has no analytics or crash reporting
download.transparent: Transparent - View the source code and verify what the app does
download.noGoogleServices: No Google services - Works without Google Play Services installed

safety.quickExitTooltip: Press ESC or click to quickly leave this site
safety.crisisSupport: Free, confidential 24/7 support. Veterans press 1, Spanish press 2.

accessibilityPage.title: Accessibility Statement
accessibilityPage.subtitle: Bay Navigator is committed to ensuring digital accessibility for people of all abilities. We continuously improve the user experience for everyone.
accessibilityPage.feedbackDesc: We welcome your feedback on the accessibility of Bay Navigator. If you encounter any barriers or have suggestions for improvement, please let us know.

offline.offlineMessage: Some features may be limited. Connect to the internet for full functionality.
offline.smartSearchDisabled: Connect to the internet to use smart search.

print.scanQR: Scan to view this page online or share with others

footer.copyright: Â© 2026 Bay Tides. Open source under MIT license.
footer.madeIn: Made with ðŸ’š in the San Francisco Bay Area
footer.description: A community resource by Bay Tides. Connecting Bay Area residents with free and low-cost programs for food, housing, healthcare, utilities, and more.

map.torNotAvailableDesc: The interactive map requires external resources that cannot be loaded through the Tor network for privacy and security reasons.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.shortVersionText: We don't track you. We don't collect personal information. We don't use cookies for tracking. We don't sell any data. This site is open source so you can verify this yourself.
privacy.dataStaysOnDevice: Data stays on your device and never leaves:
privacy.avoidAiDesc: Toggle off "Smart Search" or use Bay Navigator offline.
privacy.analyticsCollects: Self-hosted Plausible Analytics collects only aggregate data:
privacy.noCookiesNoPersonalData: No cookies. No personal data. Cannot identify individuals.
privacy.gpsStaysOnDevice: Your GPS stays on your device
privacy.gpsStaysOnDeviceDesc: Distance calculations happen locally, never sent to servers
privacy.selfHostedMapTilesDesc: Protomaps served from our infrastructure, no Google Maps
privacy.questionsDesc: Have privacy concerns or want to exercise your rights? We're here to help.
privacy.verifyPractices: Verify our privacy practices yourself at

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.tldrText: Bay Navigator is a free resource listing programs in the Bay Area. We try to keep information accurate, but always verify details with the program directly. Don't rely solely on this site for important decisions. If a dispute arises, you agree to resolve it in the courts described below, and Bay Tides' liability is capped as described in these Terms.
terms.byUsing: By using Bay Navigator, you agree to these terms
terms.termsUpdated: Terms may be updated â€” continued use means acceptance
terms.dontAgree: Don't agree? Please don't use the Service
terms.whatIsBayNavigatorDesc: A free, community-maintained directory by Bay Tides, a California 501(c)(3) nonprofit.
terms.alwaysVerify: Always verify program details directly with the provider before making decisions.
terms.mayBeIncomplete: Information may be incomplete or outdated
terms.noGuarantee: No guarantee of program availability or eligibility
terms.notLiableIndirect: Not liable for indirect, incidental, or consequential damages
terms.notLiableMissed: Not liable for missed deadlines or benefit denials
terms.liabilityLimited: Liability is limited regardless of the form of dispute resolution
terms.contactFirst: Please contact us first so we can try to resolve issues informally
terms.smallClaims: Small claims court may be available for qualifying claims
terms.otherDisputes: Otherwise, disputes will be handled in the courts described below
terms.enhancedSearchDesc1: Uses automated techniques to better match your search to program listings
terms.enhancedSearchDesc2: Not a chat or interactive advice tool
terms.enhancedSearchDesc3: Always verify details with the official program source
terms.trademarkNotice: Bay Navigator name and logo are trademarks of Bay Tides.
terms.happyToClarify: We're happy to clarify anything. Reach out anytime.
terms.questionsDesc: We're happy to clarify anything. Reach out anytime.

transit.title: Bay Area Transit
transit.subtitle: Live service alerts and information for all {count} Bay Area transit agencies. Check current service status before you travel.
transit.dataFrom: Data from {link}. Alerts refresh every 5 minutes.
transit.viewAllStops: View all {count} transit stops across the Bay Area on our interactive map.
transit.clipperDesc: Use a single Clipper card to pay for rides on all Bay Area transit agencies. Get discounts with Clipper START for low-income riders.

partnerships.title: Partner With Us
partnerships.subtitle: Help us connect more Bay Area residents to the programs and services they need. We welcome partnerships with government agencies, nonprofits, and community organizations.
partnerships.whyPartnerDesc: Promote your services on a modern platform built with the highest standards for privacy, accessibility, and sustainability.
partnerships.industryLeadingDesc: Promote your services on a sophisticated yet simple platform with some of the highest user privacy, transparency, accessibility, and environmental sustainability standards on the web.
partnerships.reachUsersDesc: Native apps for every major platform plus PWA and offline support ensure all users can access the directory anytime, anywhere â€” even without internet.
partnerships.pwaOfflineSupport: PWA + offline support on all platforms
partnerships.fullDataControlDesc: For API partners, you maintain complete control over the data you present to users. Update on your terms using your existing platforms â€” we sync automatically.
partnerships.automaticSync: Automatic sync with your existing systems
partnerships.reachMorePeopleDesc: Your programs are discovered by Bay Area residents searching for assistance.
partnerships.verifiedBadgeDesc: Programs from official sources display a verification badge, building trust.
partnerships.hundredPercentFreeDesc: No fees, no subscriptions. Ever. We're a 501(c)(3) public charity.
partnerships.howToShareDataDesc: Choose the method that works best for your organization. All three options result in your programs being listed on Bay Navigator.
partnerships.apiIntegrationDesc: If you have an existing public API with program data, we can integrate it directly. Your data stays up-to-date automatically.
partnerships.dataSubmissionDesc: Submit your program information via spreadsheet or structured data format. We'll import and maintain it for you.
partnerships.githubContributionDesc: Add programs directly to our open-source repository via pull request. Perfect for technical contributors.
partnerships.whatInfoWeNeedDesc: For each program, we collect the following information to help users find and access services.
partnerships.guidelinesAndPoliciesDesc: Before submitting your program, please review our partnership guidelines to ensure your listing meets our standards.
partnerships.publicBenefitStandardsDesc: Public benefit requirements for all listings
partnerships.nonDiscriminationDesc: Equal access for all eligible individuals
partnerships.readyToPartnerDesc: Fill out our partnership inquiry form and we'll get back to you to discuss how we can work together to help Bay Area residents.
partnerships.howToShareDesc: Choose the method that works best for your organization. All three options result in your programs being listed on Bay Navigator.
partnerships.whatInfoNeededDesc: For each program, we collect the following information to help users find and access services.
partnerships.listingGuidelinesDesc: Before submitting your program, please review our partnership guidelines to ensure your listing meets our standards.

contact.title: Partnership Inquiry
contact.subtitle: Fill out the form below and we'll get back to you to discuss how we can work together to help Bay Area residents.

guidelines.title: Partnership Guidelines
guidelines.subtitle: Standards and policies for organizations listed on Bay Navigator. These guidelines ensure our platform remains a trusted, objective resource for Bay Area residents.

partnershipsContact.title: Partnership Inquiry
partnershipsContact.subtitle: Fill out the form below and we'll get back to you to discuss how we can work together to help Bay Area residents.
partnershipsContact.howWorkWithUs: How would you like to work with us?
partnershipsContact.howCanYouHelp: How can your organization benefit the project?
partnershipsContact.tellUsAboutPrograms: Tell us about your programs, services, or resources that could help Bay Area residents...
partnershipsContact.termsAcknowledgment: I have read and agree to the Partnership Guidelines, including the 501(c)(3) public benefit standards, non-discrimination policy, and listing requirements.
partnershipsContact.bySubmitting: By submitting this form, you also agree to our
partnershipsContact.inquirySubmitted: Your partnership inquiry has been submitted. We'll be in touch soon.
partnershipsContact.somethingWentWrong: Something went wrong. Please try again or email us directly.

partnershipsGuidelines.title: Partnership Guidelines
partnershipsGuidelines.subtitle: Standards and policies for organizations listed on Bay Navigator. These guidelines ensure our platform remains a trusted, objective resource for Bay Area residents.
partnershipsGuidelines.publicBenefitDesc: Bay Navigator is a project of Bay Tides, a 501(c)(3) public charity. The project's mission is to connect Bay Area residents to essential services and public benefits. To maintain our tax-exempt status and fulfill our charitable purpose, all listed programs must meet these standards.
partnershipsGuidelines.requirementsApply: These requirements apply equally to all partnersâ€”government agencies, nonprofits, community organizations, private companies, and religious organizations.
partnershipsGuidelines.genuinePublicBenefitDesc: Programs must serve the public interest, not primarily advance private, commercial, or ideological interests
partnershipsGuidelines.unconditionalAccessDesc: Services must be accessible without conditions that advance private, commercial, or religious interests
partnershipsGuidelines.missionAlignmentDesc: Programs must align with our mission of connecting residents to essential services
partnershipsGuidelines.legalBasisDesc: These standards ensure Bay Navigator remains a trusted, objective resource while maintaining compliance with federal 501(c)(3) requirements for public charities.
partnershipsGuidelines.privateForProfitDesc: We accept limited listings for discounts or services from private and for-profit companies, provided they meet our strict standards. We do not accept payment for listings.
partnershipsGuidelines.bayAreaPresenceDesc: Notable presence in or services to the SF Bay Area
partnershipsGuidelines.genuineValueDesc: Real, tangible benefitsâ€”not marketing promotions or trials
partnershipsGuidelines.accurateInfoDesc: Keep listing info current; honor advertised terms
partnershipsGuidelines.priceTransparencyDesc: Disclose exact dollar amounts for any fees
partnershipsGuidelines.verificationDisclosureDesc: Clearly state if ID.me, SheerID, etc. is required
partnershipsGuidelines.ongoingProgramsDesc: Routine or recurring (seasonal like "tax season" OK)
partnershipsGuidelines.nonDiscriminationReqDesc: Available to all within stated eligibility categories
partnershipsGuidelines.directLinksOnlyDesc: Clean URLs without tracking or shorteners
partnershipsGuidelines.paidMembershipsDesc: No discounts requiring AARP, AAA, Costco, etc.
partnershipsGuidelines.trackingUrlsDesc: No UTMs, referral codes, or link shorteners
partnershipsGuidelines.baitAndSwitchDesc: No advertising benefits that differ from what's offered
partnershipsGuidelines.predatoryServicesDesc: No payday loans, debt scams, or hidden fees
partnershipsGuidelines.dataHarvestingDesc: No services primarily collecting info for marketing
partnershipsGuidelines.misrepresentationDesc: No claiming to be government/nonprofit when you're not
partnershipsGuidelines.limitedTimePromosDesc: No flash sales, holiday deals, or short-term campaigns
partnershipsGuidelines.platformManipulationDesc: No gaming search, rankings, or API abuse
partnershipsGuidelines.noVerifiedBadgeDesc: Listings from private companies do not receive verified badges.
partnershipsGuidelines.editorialDiscretionDesc: We reserve the right to decline, modify, or remove any listing at any time, with or without notice, for any reason. Submission does not guarantee inclusion.
partnershipsGuidelines.acknowledgmentDesc: By submitting a listingâ€”whether directly via email, through GitHub, or via APIâ€”authorized representatives acknowledge and agree to our Terms of Service, listing requirements, content standards, and Non-Discrimination Policy.
partnershipsGuidelines.religiousOrgDesc: Religious organizations are welcome to list programs that provide genuine public benefits to Bay Area residents. However, consistent with our 501(c)(3) obligations, programs must be accessible without religious participation or proselytization.
partnershipsGuidelines.religiousOrgNote: This is a public benefits guide. When someone needs food, healthcare, or other essential services, they should access them without religious conditions.
partnershipsGuidelines.secularServiceDeliveryDesc: Programs listed on Bay Navigator must be accessible to the public without religious participation, observation, or material distribution.
partnershipsGuidelines.acceptableReligious1: Religious organizations may operate programs and identify their religious affiliation
partnershipsGuidelines.acceptableReligious2: Programs may be held at houses of worship (churches, mosques, temples, synagogues)
partnershipsGuidelines.acceptableReligious3: Staff and volunteers may identify their religious affiliation when asked
partnershipsGuidelines.acceptableReligious4: Religious symbols and dÃ©cor may be present in the facility
partnershipsGuidelines.notAllowedReligious1: Requiring attendance at religious services, prayer, or worship to access programs
partnershipsGuidelines.notAllowedReligious2: Distributing religious materials (pamphlets, scriptures, tracts) alongside services
partnershipsGuidelines.notAllowedReligious3: Including religious materials in donated items (hidden or visible)
partnershipsGuidelines.notAllowedReligious4: Requiring religious declarations, conversions, or statements of faith
partnershipsGuidelines.notAllowedReligious5: Using service delivery as an opportunity for proselytization or evangelism
partnershipsGuidelines.religiousFreedomDesc: Religious organizations are welcome to list programs that meet these standards. This policy does not restrict religious practiceâ€”it ensures that public benefit programs remain accessible without religious participation. Listing on Bay Navigator is voluntary; organizations that wish to combine service delivery with religious activities are free to do so outside our directory.
partnershipsGuidelines.enforcementDesc: Reports of religious material distribution or participation requirements may result in removal from the directory. See our reporting process below.
partnershipsGuidelines.nonDiscriminationPolicyDesc: Bay Navigator prohibits discrimination. As a free community service committed to serving all Bay Area residents, we maintain strict standards to ensure our platform remains inclusive and welcoming to everyone.
partnershipsGuidelines.nonDiscriminationText: All programs and services listed on Bay Navigator must be provided without discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.
partnershipsGuidelines.commitment1: We only list programs that serve all eligible individuals equally
partnershipsGuidelines.commitment2: We design our platform to be accessible to people of all abilities
partnershipsGuidelines.commitment3: We provide information in plain language to serve all literacy levels
partnershipsGuidelines.reportingDesc: If we directly or indirectly receive reports of actions that violate our guidelinesâ€”including discrimination, religious proselytization during service delivery, or misrepresentationâ€”we reserve the right to investigate such claims as they pertain to the organization's listing on our platform.
partnershipsGuidelines.followingInvestigation: Following an investigation, we may, in our sole discretion:
partnershipsGuidelines.suspendListing: Temporarily suspend the listing pending review
partnershipsGuidelines.removeListing: Permanently remove the listing from Bay Navigator
partnershipsGuidelines.declineFuture: Decline future listing requests from the organization
partnershipsGuidelines.toReportConcern: To report a concern, please email
partnershipsGuidelines.withDetails: with details about the program and the nature of your concern.
partnershipsGuidelines.readyToPartnerDesc: Now that you understand our guidelines, submit a partnership inquiry to get started.

credits.title: Credits & Acknowledgments
credits.subtitle: Bay Navigator is built with open-source software and privacy-respecting services. We're grateful to these projects and their contributors.
credits.microsoftDesc: Azure cloud credits and GitHub Team sponsorship enabling our infrastructure.
credits.cloudflareDesc: Business-tier CDN, DDoS protection, and security services.
credits.azureDesc: Static Web Apps, AI Search, Functions
credits.censusGeocoderDesc: District lookups for Find My Rep
credits.accessibilityIntro: We're committed to WCAG 2.2 AAA compliance and follow emerging WCAG 3.0 draft guidelines. These resources guide our accessibility work.
credits.openSourceCommitmentDesc: Bay Navigator is open source under the MIT license. We believe in giving back to the communities that make our work possible.

sustainability.title: Environmental Sustainability
sustainability.subtitle: As an environmental nonprofit, Bay Tides is committed to practicing what we preach. Here's how Bay Navigator minimizes its digital carbon footprint.
sustainability.dashboardIntro: Estimated usage data based on our Azure, Cloudflare, and GitHub infrastructure. According to their published reports, all providers aim to use 100% renewable energy.
sustainability.emissionsBreakdown: Emissions breakdown (grams COâ‚‚e, before renewable offset):
sustainability.azureStackDesc: Our website is hosted on Azure, which has been carbon neutral since 2012 and achieved 100% renewable energy in 2025.
sustainability.cloudflareStackDesc: Cloudflare powers our content delivery with 100% renewable energy and achieved net-zero emissions in 2025.
sustainability.githubStackDesc: Our code is hosted on GitHub, which has been net-zero carbon since 2019. They're also a co-founder of the Green Software Foundation.
sustainability.workersAiStackDesc: Our Smart Search uses Cloudflare Workers AI with the Llama 3.1 8B model, running on Cloudflare's carbon-neutral edge network with 100% renewable energy.
sustainability.azureOpenaiStackDesc: Our Simple Language accessibility feature uses Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o-mini) weekly to simplify complex words for users with lower literacy, running on Microsoft's carbon-neutral infrastructure.
sustainability.staticSiteDesc: Bay Navigator is built with Astro, generating static HTML at build time. This means minimal server processing per request, reducing energy consumption.
sustainability.edgeCachingDesc: Content is cached at Cloudflare's edge locations worldwide, reducing data transfer distances and server load.
sustainability.minimalJsDesc: We ship minimal JavaScript to browsers, reducing download sizes and client-side processing energy.
sustainability.onDeviceDesc: Location calculations, personalization settings, and saved favorites all stay on your deviceâ€”reducing server requests and keeping your data private.
sustainability.paperlessDesc: By digitizing benefit discovery, we help reduce paper applications, mailings, and in-person visits that generate transportation emissions.
sustainability.strategicAiDesc: Our Smart Search uses AI intentionallyâ€”helping users find resources efficiently rather than requiring multiple searches or phone calls.
sustainability.impactIntro: Traditional benefit discovery often involves paper applications, phone calls, and in-person visits. Here's how Bay Navigator's digital approach compares:
sustainability.impactNote: * Estimates based on EPA emissions data and website carbon calculators. Actual values vary by usage patterns.
sustainability.questionsDesc: We're committed to transparency. If you have questions about our environmental practices or suggestions for improvement, we'd love to hear from you.

glossary.title: Glossary of Terms
glossary.subtitle: Definitions of {count} common abbreviations and terms used in government benefit programs.
glossary.wcagNote: WCAG 2.2 AAA: 3.1.4 Abbreviations - Providing mechanisms for identifying expanded forms of abbreviations.
glossary.noResults: No terms found matching your search.
